# HP Inc. (HPQ) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

HP Inc. is an American multinational information technology company with its headquarters in Palo Alto, California, that develops personal computers (PCs), printers and related supplies, as well as 3D printing services. It is the world's second-largest personal computer vendor by unit sales after Lenovo and ahead of Dell as of 2024. The company was formed in November 2015 following the split of the original Hewlett-Packard Company into two separate entities - HP Inc. focused on personal computing and printing, while Hewlett Packard Enterprise handles enterprise products and services.

HP Inc. operates through three main segments: Personal Systems (which includes commercial and consumer desktop/notebook computers, workstations, and mobility devices), Printing (consumer and commercial printer hardware, supplies, and services), and Corporate Investments (HP Labs and business incubation projects). HP Inc. is the direct descendant of the original Hewlett-Packard Company, which Bill Hewlett and David Packard famously started in a Palo Alto garage back in 1939. The company you see today was officially formed on November 1, 2015, after the split from Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), which handles the server and enterprise side. HP Inc. kept the focus on personal computing and printing, which are still its bread and butter.

The company is undergoing a significant transformation toward AI-enabled products and services, with most of its PC models (except Omen) adopting a new branding nomenclature under the new Omni brand, which consisted of the OmniBook, OmniStudio and OmniDesk models. The new Omni brand of computers featured AI-powered hardware and software, and currently coexists with HP's other existing, non-AI products as of 2025.

## 2. Current Market Data

**Stock Price & Market Cap:**
- As of today, HP(HPQ) shares are valued at $20.45.
- As of January 2026 HP has a market cap of $19.18 Billion USD.
- The stock's 52-week range extends from a low of $19.95 to a high of $35.28.
- The company's market cap stands at 18.71B, with a P/E ratio of 7.68 and a dividend yield of 5.7%.

**Recent Performance:**
- Its market cap has decreased by -38.29% in one year.
- The current price of HPQ is 20.37 USD — it has decreased by −1.16% in the past 24 hours.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

**Personal Systems Portfolio:**
- Its consumer PCs as of 2024 include the Essential line and Pavilion (consumer), Envy (high-end and prosumer), and Omen (gaming), as well as AI-powered PCs marketed under the Omni brand such as the OmniBook, OmniDesk and OmniStudio.
- HP's business computers are marketed under the "Pro" and "Elite" prefixes. In the professional space, HP market the HP Z series of desktop workstations and its mobile equivalent, HP ZBook.

**Printing Portfolio:**
- It also manufactures the DeskJet, OfficeJet, LaserJet, and Envy series of printers and the ScanJet line of image scanners.
- Advanced printing solutions for commercial and industrial applications

**3D Printing Solutions:**
- HP continues to advance 3D printing with the introduction of new configurations for the HP Metal Jet S100 platform, enhancing quality, repeatability, speed, and reliability across a broader range of production needs. These initiatives will empower research centers, OEMs, national laboratories, and startups to explore metal binder jetting, reducing entry-level adoption costs while ensuring a scalable and consistent platform.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**AI PC Strategy:**
- HP is focusing on premium categories and increasing AI PC penetration to 40-50% by 2026.
- In Q4 2025, AI PCs exceeded 30% of shipments, a quarter ahead of plan, with management targeting 40-50% in fiscal 2026.
- HP meticulously designed its latest lineup of commercial next-gen AI PCs to give professionals the right tools for their unique work experiences. With HP's newest EliteBooks, fast presentation creation, personalized emails, and a built-in recording studio are possible with just a simple click of a button, alongside built-in security and intelligence thanks to Wolf Security.

**AI Software Investments:**
- HP Inc. (NYSE: HPQ) announced a definitive agreement to acquire key AI capabilities from Humane, including their AI-powered platform Cosmos, highly skilled technical talent, and intellectual property with more than 300 patents and patent applications.
- This investment will rapidly accelerate our ability to develop a new generation of devices that seamlessly orchestrate AI requests both locally and in the cloud. Humane's AI platform Cosmos, backed by an incredible group of engineers, will help us create an intelligent ecosystem across all HP devices from AI PCs to smart printers and connected conference rooms.

**3D Printing Innovations:**
- The new configurations are expected to be available in 2025. In parallel, HP is collaborating with Volkmann and Sinterzone, which are developing their own configurations for the HP S100 platform.
- In the 3D printing sector, HP is enhancing its Metal Jet S100 platform with new materials and software. The HP 3D Build Optimizer, introduced in early 2025, is projected to significantly reduce build costs.

## 5. Growth Strategy

**Cost Management:**
- The company is actively managing its cost structure through its 'Future Ready' plan, aiming for $1.9 billion in structural cost savings by the end of fiscal year 2025, an upward revision from its initial target of $1.6 billion. This initiative is central to its HP business strategy for enhancing profitability.
- Today, HP Inc. announced a company-wide initiative ("fiscal 2026 plan") to drive customer satisfaction, product innovation, and productivity through artificial intelligence adoption and enablement. The company estimates that these actions will result in gross run rate savings of approximately $1 billion by the end of fiscal 2028. The company estimates that it will incur approximately $650 million in labor and non-labor costs related to restructuring and other charges, with approximately $250 million in fiscal 2026. The company expects to reduce gross global headcount by approximately 4,000-6,000 employees.

**AI-First Transformation:**
- CEO Enrique Lores emphasized the transformative potential of AI, stating, "We have a significant opportunity to embed AI in everything we do and transform the company."
- HP Inc.'s core mission is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. This is a broad mandate, but it's anchored by a clear, secondary mission: to engineer experiences that amaze. This dual focus-global impact and exceptional user experience-is the strategic filter for every major investment, from AI-powered PCs to their industrial 3D printing portfolio.

**Services and Subscriptions Focus:**
- HP is expanding its subscription-based services, including offerings for paper and printers. This strategy is designed to create more predictable, recurring revenue streams for the company.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

**Enterprise Clients:**
- It serves small- and medium-sized businesses, public sector, and large enterprises.
- HP Inc. serves approximately 300,000 SMB customers worldwide. SMB segment represented 28% of total PC sales in 2023

**Global Partnerships:**
- The partnership with SAMI Advanced Electronics to manufacture computers in Saudi Arabia targets AI-driven enterprise markets, aligning with global tech trends and expanding its revenue base. Millions of computers are set to be manufactured in Saudi Arabia by HP through a partnership with SAMI Advanced Electronics, targeting enterprise customers with a focus on artificial intelligence by 2030.
- Collaboration with RingCentral emphasizes the role of HP in advancing AI communications, reflecting a commitment to innovation and adaptability.

**Educational and Research Institutions:**
- HP collaborates with educational institutions for research and development, focusing on innovation in printing technology and personal computing. For example, HP has partnered with universities to advance research in 3D printing technologies.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Fiscal 2025 Results:**
- Fiscal 2025 net revenue of $55.3 billion, up 3.2% from the prior-year period
- Fiscal 2025 GAAP diluted net EPS was $2.65, down from $2.81 in the prior-year. Fiscal 2025 non-GAAP diluted net EPS was $3.12, down from $3.43 in the prior-year period.
- Fiscal 2025 net cash provided by operating activities of $3.7 billion, free cash flow of $2.9 billion

**Q4 2025 Performance:**
- Fourth quarter net revenue was $14.6 billion, up 4.2% from the prior-year period
- Fourth quarter non-GAAP diluted net EPS of $0.93, down 3.1% from the prior year period
- Fourth quarter net cash provided by operating activities of $1.6 billion, free cash flow of $1.5 billion

**Revenue Breakdown (Fiscal 2023):**
- In fiscal year 2023, total revenue of US$54 billion included US$24.7 billion from the sale of notebook computers, US$10.9 billion from the sale of desktop computers, US$11.4 billion from the sale of printer supplies, US$4.2 billion from the sale of commercial printers, and US$2.4 billion from the sale of consumer printers.

**Future Guidance:**
- For fiscal year 2026, HP provided a non-GAAP EPS guidance range of $2.90 to $3.20. The company expects stronger personal systems revenue in the latter half of the year, although memory cost pressures are anticipated.
- FY 2026 Guidance -- Non-GAAP diluted EPS expected between $2.90 and $3.20, and free cash flow between $2.8 billion and $3 billion, factoring in a $0.30 EPS impact from memory cost increases.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds:**
- **AI PC Adoption:** HP's 25.1% U.S. market share in Q1 2025 and 44% AI PC adoption rate in notebook shipments highlight its leadership in a market projected to grow at a 26.6% CAGR through 2031.
- **Windows 11 Migration:** The timeline leading to this moment was defined by a frantic 2025, during which the retirement of Windows 10 forced millions of legacy devices out of service. Microsoft's end-of-support for Windows 10 in October 2025 has forced enterprises and consumers to upgrade, creating a multi-year replacement cycle.
- **Supply Chain Resilience:** The company has successfully relocated its North American market production out of China, helping it avoid the worst potential tariff-related impacts on profitability.

**Headwinds:**
- **Memory Cost Inflation:** The non-GAAP EPS range of $2.90-$3.20 includes a $0.30 headwind from memory costs, net of mitigation efforts, implying underlying earnings power of $3.20-$3.50. This proactive quantification of the impact, rather than hoping for commodity relief, highlights the magnitude of the challenge—memory inflation alone represents a
- **PC Market Contraction:** Because so many enterprises upgraded their hardware in late 2024 and 2025 to meet the Windows 10 end-of-life deadline, total PC shipments are projected to contract by 2% to 5% throughout 2026.
- **Printing Segment Decline:** The Printing segment, which contributes 32% of revenue, declined 4% in Q3 due to weak demand in China and delayed enterprise spending.

## 9. Market Shares

**PC Market Position:**
- The overall market leader in the global personal computer market in 2023 was Lenovo with a market share of 24.7 percent with HP Inc. in at second with a 21.9 percent share. In terms of unit shipments, Lenovo recorded 59.7 million, while HP Inc. had around 52.9 million.
- In the second quarter of 2024, HP Inc.'s market share of global PC shipments stood at 22.6 percent, making HP the second largest PC vendor overall behind only Lenovo.

**Printing Market:**
- IDC reported that in Q1 2025, HP delivered approximately 6.66 million hardcopy peripherals, resulting in 34.4% of the global printer and MFP market. In the fourth quarter of 2024, HP shipped approximately 7.5 million units, accounting for a 34.2% market share.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**Primary Competitors:**
- **Lenovo:** Market leader with 24.7% global PC market share
- **Dell:** In the third quarter of 2024, Dell held a 15.7 percent share of global PC unit shipments, lower than the 16.7 percent share the company held in the second quarter of 2024. Dell sits as the number three PC vendor in the world following Lenovo and HP.

**Competitive Positioning:**
- Dell Technologies (NYSE: DELL) continues to be a formidable opponent for HP, having capitalized on the 2025 refresh cycle to build a massive $18.4 billion AI server backlog. While HP is winning on hardware aesthetics and modularity, Dell's "AI Factory" approach—linking end-user PCs to robust back-end infrastructure—gives it a distinct advantage with large-scale corporate clients.
- Conversely, Lenovo (OTC: LNVGY) remains the global volume leader, but faces potential headwinds as it navigates the high costs of maintaining an AI lead in a market where memory and storage prices have surged by as much as 70% over the last 14 months.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Acquisitions:**
- HP's most recent acquisition is Vyopta, a Cloud based video communication monitoring and management software, acquired in September 2024. Vyopta specializes in cloud-based video communication monitoring and management software.
- HP Inc. (NYSE: HPQ) announced a definitive agreement to acquire key AI capabilities from Humane, including their AI-powered platform Cosmos, highly skilled technical talent, and intellectual property with more than 300 patents and patent applications.

**Strategic Partnerships:**
- In April 2024, HP announced that they have signed a multi-year deal to become the title sponsor for the Ferrari team, extending to the team's F1 Academy and esports programs.
- In February 2024, HP signed a 3-year sleeve sponsorship deal with Real Madrid, becoming the first sleeve sponsor in the club's 121-year history.
- HP's collaboration with ArcelorMittal, a leader in sustainable steel production, demonstrates how HP Metal Jet S100 technology is advancing 3D printing across industrial sectors like automotive. By combining HP's additive manufacturing expertise with ArcelorMittal's sustainable steel innovations, this partnership aims to reduce production costs, expand material options, and

**Technology Partnerships:**
- HP Inc. collaborates with major technology providers such as Intel and AMD to enhance its product offerings in personal computers and printers. For instance, HP utilizes Intel's 13th Gen Core processors in its latest laptop models, which contributes to improved performance and efficiency.

## 12. Recent Developments

**2025 Key Developments:**
- **AI Transformation:** Today, HP Inc. announced a company-wide initiative ("fiscal 2026 plan") to drive customer satisfaction, product innovation, and productivity through artificial intelligence adoption and enablement.
- **CES 2025 Showcase:** Today at CES 2025, future business leaders will be wowed by new and powerful AI PCs and solutions from HP Inc. (NYSE: HPQ) that empower them to collaborate and lead like never before.
- **Workforce Optimization:** HP CEO Enrique Lores said in a press conference that the company plans to cut between 4,000 and 6,000 jobs over the next three years as it uses artificial intelligence tools across its business to cut costs, save about $1 billion and accelerate product innovation.

**2024 Highlights:**
- **Omni Brand Launch:** In May 2024, HP announced its intentions on restructuring their lineup of consumer PCs in preparation for the next generation of computers with artificial intelligence, stating that most of its PC models (except Omen) would adopt a new branding nomenclature under the new Omni brand.
- **3D Printing Expansion:** Today at Formnext 2024, HP Inc. (NYSE: HPQ) unveiled breakthrough innovations in polymer and metal 3D printing, alongside strategic collaborations that push the boundaries of additive manufacturing across industries. Reinforcing its commitment to broadening access to additive manufacturing, HP introduced solutions aimed at reducing costs, scaling production, and accelerating adoption across diverse applications.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Investment Rating: 6.5/10**

**Rationale:**
HP Inc. presents a mixed investment opportunity with both significant potential and meaningful challenges. The company is well-positioned for the AI PC transformation cycle but faces structural headwinds that limit near-term upside.

**Positive Factors:**
- Strong market position as second-largest PC vendor globally
- Leading AI PC adoption rates ahead of competitors
- Successful cost management with $2.2B in Future Ready savings
- Strategic AI acquisitions (Humane platform) positioning for long-term growth
- Strong free cash flow generation ($2.9B in fiscal 2025) and consistent dividend growth

**Risk Factors:**
- Significant memory cost inflation headwinds ($0.30 EPS impact in FY26)
- Declining printing segment representing 32% of revenue
- PC market contraction expected in 2026 due to refresh cliff
- High execution risk with workforce reduction of 4,000-6,000 employees
- Market cap decline of 38% over past year reflects investor pessimism

**Fair Value Estimate: $28.50**

Based on:
- Forward P/E multiple of 9.5x on midpoint FY26 guidance of $3.05 EPS
- Premium valuation warranted for AI PC leadership and transformation potential
- Dividend yield support at current levels (~6% yield attractive for income investors)
- Recovery potential as memory cost pressures ease in 2027-2028

The stock appears undervalued at current levels around $20, but significant near-term headwinds limit upside until the company demonstrates successful execution of its AI transformation strategy and memory cost mitigation efforts. Suitable for investors seeking exposure to AI PC trends with patience for multi-year value realization.
tldr_summary:
HP Inc. is a multinational technology company specializing in personal computers, printers, and 3D printing solutions, ranking second globally in PC market share. 

The company is aggressively transforming through AI-powered innovation, targeting 40-50% AI PC penetration by 2026 and investing heavily in AI capabilities, including the acquisition of Humane's AI platform. HP is strategically repositioning its product lineup with the new Omni brand of AI-enabled devices and implementing a "Future Ready" cost management plan targeting $1.9 billion in structural savings. Despite facing headwinds like memory cost inflation and PC market contraction, HP maintains a strong market position with 21.9% global PC market share and a diversified portfolio spanning consumer, commercial, and industrial segments.

HP receives an investment rating of 6.5/10, with a fair value estimate of $28.50, reflecting potential AI transformation upside balanced against near-term market challenges.
